Method Detail

receiveFromEISForService

public java.lang.Object receiveFromEISForService(javax.transaction.xa.XAResource xaResource,
                                                 java.lang.String serviceJNDIName,
                                                 java.util.HashMap<? extends java.io.Serializable,? extends java.io.Serializable> serviceParameters,
                                                 byte[] payloadBytes,
                                                 java.lang.String payloadContentType,
                                                 java.lang.String payloadCharset)
                                          throws XtentisConnectorException
This is a simplified call to the full OnMessage Method. The EIS should call this method to push a message to the Application Server. The method will throw an XtentisConnectorException if the return code form the application server is not STATUS_OK. The exception message will contain the Application Server Error message.

Parameters:
xaResource - - can be null if you do not want transaction management
serviceParameters - - an hashMap of parameters to pass to the service
payloadBytes - - the payload itself as an Array of bytes
payloadContentType - - the content-type e.g "text/xml", "text/plain",....
payloadCharset - - the charset/encoding e.g. "utf-8", "iso-8859-1", ....
Returns:
an Object being the response of the Application Server
Throws:
XtentisConnectorException

onMessage

@Deprecated
public java.lang.Object onMessage(java.lang.Object callingConnector,
                                             java.lang.Object message)
                           throws XtentisConnectorException
Deprecated. 

Description copied from interface: IXtentisResourceAdapter
The EIS/Connector wants to push a message to the application server Notes: The EIS/Connector must implement XAResource Calls to this method may be made by multiple threads Implementation of the message is application specific Whether this method should return an actual object is also implemenatation specific

Specified by:
onMessage in interface IXtentisResourceAdapter
Parameters:
callingConnector - the calling Connector/EIS
message - the actual message
Returns:
a message or null, as expected
Throws:
XtentisConnectorException

pullFromEIS

public abstract java.util.HashMap<java.io.Serializable,java.io.Serializable> pullFromEIS(java.util.HashMap<java.io.Serializable,java.io.Serializable> parametersIn)
                                                                                  throws XtentisConnectorException
This method is invoked by the application server to pull data from the EIS. (If the EIS needs to push data to the Application Server, it should call the receiveFromEIS method) If the method fails, make sure you throw an XtentisConnectorException. The message of the exception will be passed backed as the message and the code will be set to STATUS_ERROR and the status will be set to STATUS_ERROR.

Parameters:
parametersIn - - parameters passed by the Application server
Returns:
a Hashmap containing data to be passed back to the Application Server
Throws:
XtentisConnectorException

pushToEIS

public abstract java.util.HashMap<java.io.Serializable,java.io.Serializable> pushToEIS(java.util.HashMap<java.io.Serializable,java.io.Serializable> parametersIn)
                                                                                throws XtentisConnectorException
This method is invoked by the application server to push data to the EIS If the method fails, make sure you throw an XtentisConnectorException. The message of the exception will be passed backed as the message and the code will be set to STATUS_ERROR and the status will be set to STATUS_ERROR

Parameters:
parametersIn - - parameters passed by the Application server
Returns:
a Hashmap containing data to be passed back to the Application Server
Throws:
XtentisConnectorException

getRunningConfiguration

public abstract java.util.HashMap<java.io.Serializable,java.io.Serializable> getRunningConfiguration()
                                                                                              throws XtentisConnectorException
This method must return the configuration in use by your running Connector. The configuration will be serialized on start and stop of the connector and used by the application server to restart your connector froms its saved configuration. On start, the configuration HashMap will be passed to the startNow method as parameters..

Returns:
the running configuration
Throws:
XtentisConnectorException

getStatus

public abstract java.lang.String[] getStatus(java.util.HashMap<java.io.Serializable,java.io.Serializable> parametersIn)
                                      throws XtentisConnectorException
This method is invoked by the application server retrieve the Connector status. The methods should returned two Strings -the first one being one of the values of STATUS_OK, STATUS_ERROR, STATUS_STOPPED -the second one, a text message If the method fails, make sure you throw an XtentisConnectorException. The message of the exception will be passed backed as the message and the code will be set to STATUS_ERROR and the status will be set to STATUS_ERROR

Parameters:
parametersIn - - parameters passed by the Application server
Returns:
an Array of 2 Strings. The first one contains the status and the second one a possible message.
Throws:
XtentisConnectorException

startNow

public abstract java.util.HashMap<java.io.Serializable,java.io.Serializable> startNow(java.util.HashMap<java.io.Serializable,java.io.Serializable> parametersIn)
                                                                               throws XtentisConnectorException
This method is invoked by the application server to start your Connector Use this method to start threads on your connector. The configuration is automatically saved before the call to this method. To override this automatic save, reimplement public MappedRecord startConnector(MappedRecord recordIn) throws XtentisConnectorException If the method fails, make sure you throw an XtentisConnectorException. The message of the exception will be passed backed in the message entry of the returned HashMap and the status will be set to STATUS_ERROR

Parameters:
parametersIn - - parameters passed by the Application server
Returns:
a Hasmap containing - typically - a status message
Throws:
XtentisConnectorException

stopNow

public abstract java.util.HashMap<java.io.Serializable,java.io.Serializable> stopNow(java.util.HashMap<java.io.Serializable,java.io.Serializable> parametersIn)
                                                                              throws XtentisConnectorException
This method is invoked by the application server to stop your Connector Use this method to stop threads started by your connector. The configuration is automatically saved after the call to this method. To override this automatic save, reimplement public MappedRecord stopConnector(MappedRecord recordIn) throws XtentisConnectorException If the method fails, make sure you throw an XtentisConnectorException. The message of the exception will be passed backed in the message entry of the returned HashMap and the status will be set to STATUS_ERROR

Parameters:
parametersIn - - parameters passed by the Application server
Returns:
a Hasmap containing - typically - a status message
Throws:
XtentisConnectorException

getJNDIName

public abstract java.lang.String getJNDIName()
This method must return the JNDI name of the connector identical to the one found in the META-INF/ds.xml Typical example:"java:jca/xtentis/connector/myconnector";

Returns:
the JNDI name
